discourse_list.title: What's going on with participation here?

content.content: I haven’t been around here for awhile but Ive been in crypto and DeFi for a long time and I want to get more involved in governance. I’m also launching a crypto hedge fund. I’m surprised by the lack of topics in the forum and also how slowly topics move even in a protocol as prominent as MakerDAO. I know it’s hard to get people to participate but I remember it being more busy and lively around here last year. Has it just been winnowed down to whales at this point?
I can’t speak to if it’s gotten slower here, but… have you checked the forums of other protocols? Ghost town
Other than YFI governance I would agree that many of the best protocols including AAVE are complete ghost towns. The free-rider problem is real.

Most of us have non-Maker day jobs, so we find odd hours of the day or night to engage. That said, the level of conversation here is elevated, especially when looked at in comparison to other protocols though we may be “slow” in some regards. I for one like the academic debate at times to filter out less-than-ideal solutions and arrive at some sort of consensus.
Agreed, there seems to be an unwritten community rule which values post quality over post quantity.

PaperImperium:  I can’t speak to if it’s gotten slower here, but… have you checked the forums of other protocols? Ghost town     I totally agree, I was waiting to read and participate in IdexCoop or 1hive, and here I am still waiting.     ejbarraza:  Other than YFI governance I would agree that many of the best protocols including AAVE are complete ghost towns. The free-rider problem is real.   I think we have good traction and mobility in networks, telegram groups. Also a lot of activity in this group, compared to the other YFI and we think we are the most active.
The traditional way to attract is with incentives, unfortunately this is the reason why they turn into phantasmagorical towns.
Alefcripto:  phantasmagorical   Now that is a “five dollar word,” as my grandmother would say.
Your grandmother was not wrong, I really thought it was funny to include the word.
